content.description: Start up "Mild Kingdom". From the anchors, step slightly right across the sloping ledge/ramp system, and continue up the beautiful overhanging, blue and gold-streaked headwall.
content.location: Obvious trough/groove to overhanging headwall, after crossing the sloping ledge.

content.description:
Sustained vertical face to slightly overhanging headwall with a short slab section in between.  The crux comes just below the slab moving from a right-hand sidepull and a small left-hand crimp to a jug out right.

The upper headwall is harder than it looks and a little cryptic, with the best holds wandering left and right of the bolt line.  The route is excellent overall, with the only downside being that the holds on the lower portion are pretty sharp.

Start up Mystery Route but hang a right at the 3rd bolt. Undercling right out a big flake feature then move back left into the shallow dihedral. The crux is around the 9th bolt and might be more tricky than hard.
content.location: Right side of the Mystery Wall.

content.description: Trend left through a couple of overlaps, then pull a small roof off of a sloping ledge. The angle eases up for a few bolts along a flake, before getting steep again right before the anchors.
content.location: Furthest right route on the Mystery Tower.

content.description:
First route at the Caves and still one of the best.

Follow a plumb line up the tallest section of the Mystery Tower.  There's a load of 5.11-ish climbing with a distinct crux about halfway up, involving some sharpish but positive crimps and a 2-finger pocket.
content.location: Farthest right route on the wall, just right of the obvious left-leaning ramp system.

content.description: Stem up the trough past big holds and good feet. The crux is moving a bit right after the fifth bolt and may feel harder or easier, depending on whether you pick the better holds. Premium rock on this one.
content.location: Look for the obvious trough/groove that ends at a sloping ledge.

content.description:
Cool stemming corner up prickly but excellent rock.

This was a dirty and junky gear start (with a lone plated bolt) to the otherwise fully-bolted "Magic Kingdom", which continues up the beautiful headwall. I replaced the old bolt and added new bolts.
content.location: Obvious sloping ramp system splitting two vertical walls.

content.description:
Start up "Magic: The Gathering". From the anchors, continue right up the beautiful overhanging, blue and gold-streaked headwall.

If you decipher the crux wrong, this thing will feel harder than .12b. Regardless, the last 5 bolts are pretty full-on with little in the way of rests.
Steep face with slopers, underclings and sidepulls.
content.location: Between A.A.D. and Son of a Preacher Man.

content.description: Steep laybacking up a shallow groove. Bouldery crux between 6th and 7th bolts that may be slightly height-dependent.
content.location: Left-most route on the Mystery Tower.
